page.title: 01Review of the Longhope Area
page.content: The area under study is rural comprising woodland, farmland and the village communities of Longhope and MayHill.Longhope itself is situated on the edge of the Forest of Dean,16km. from Gloucester,11km. from Ross-on-Wye and 9km. from Cinderford.Gloucester and Ross are reached on the A40 which serves the area.Cinderford is reached on the A4136 Monmouth road which leaves the A40 at Huntley.The village of Longhope stretches between these roads. {"Longhope"}means a long enclosed valley.The highest point is the summit of MayHill,a county landmark with its clump of trees visible for miles around.There are many orchards in the area and the most notable tree is the plum known as the Blaisdon Red.
